intro: Norna, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a rare and elusive plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, translucent petals that appear to shimmer in the sunlight, giving it a ghostly appearance. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found growing in shaded, rocky crevices. Its flowers bloom only during specific times of the year, making it a subject of fascination for botanists and plant enthusiasts. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, the norna is considered a symbol of mystery and beauty in the botanical world.
